suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
the role of smell in human memory formation

formats.name: dialogue_snippet
formats.instruction: Write a fragment of a conversation between two characters discussing your topic—just their lines, no narration. Each character gets up to 3 lines. Be concise yet revealing.

formats.name: mini_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare your unique belief or philosophy in bold, unapologetic language. Use bullet points for each principle (3-5 total). No intro or explanation—just the core statements.

formats.name: memory_flashback
formats.instruction: Write a vivid, sensory-rich flashback to a moment that shifted your perspective. Describe the scene, feeling, and realization in one focused paragraph.

formats.name: rapid_fire_questions
formats.instruction: List 5 curious questions that hit different facets of the topic. Each question should not exceed one sentence. No answers, just the questions.

formats.name: mini_photo_essay
formats.instruction: Describe 3 imaginary photos that represent your topic. For each, detail what would be pictured, the mood, and any subtle symbolism in 2-3 sentences.

formats.name: chain_reaction
formats.instruction: Write a cause-and-effect chain: each sentence follows from the previous, showing surprising consequences. Minimum 4 links, maximum 7. No summary at the end.

formats.name: unpopular_ode
formats.instruction: Compose a short poetic tribute to something unpopular or overlooked, using vivid, lyrical language. Minimum 6 lines, maximum 10. No explanation.

formats.name: deep_dive_casefile
formats.instruction: Write a detailed 'case file': document facts, timeline, key players, and possible outcomes for a real or hypothetical issue. Use section headers, bullet points, and a closing 'verdict.'

formats.name: future_projection
formats.instruction: Predict what will change about your topic in the next decade, using speculative but grounded reasoning. Reference trends and possible scenarios in a thoughtful mini-essay.

formats.name: tiny_rant
formats.instruction: Go off for exactly three sentences about something that frustrates you. Make each sentence punchy, escalating in intensity.

title_styles: Write the title as a question you’ve never seen before.
Use a metaphor or analogy in the title: 'X is the new Y'
Frame the title as a challenge or dare: 'What if we tried X?'
Open the title with a surprising statistic or fact.
Write the title as a fragmented 'thought' or overheard snippet: 'Just realized, X...'
Use a poetic or playful turn of phrase that hints at the topic.
structure_variants: Begin with a vivid description, then zoom out to broader implications.
Present your main argument, follow with counterpoints, then state your conclusion.
Build suspense: start with clues, reveal the twist, explain the significance.
Tell it as a timeline: event by event, leading to the key moment.
Write each paragraph from a different perspective—switch characters or viewpoints.
Start with a hypothetical scenario, unpack possible outcomes, then relate to reality.
topic_angles: Explore how digital privacy shapes everyday habits.
Investigate the hidden rituals behind remote work.
Unpack subtle social hierarchies in group chats.
Forecast the quirks of AI-assisted creativity.
Analyze the impact of micro-trends on urban culture.
